articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA and SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — A Hezbollah drone attack on an army base in central Israel killed four soldiers and severely wounded seven others Sunday, the military said, in the deadliest strike by the militant group since Israel launched its ground invasion of Lebanon nearly two weeks ago.
articles.title: Israel’s military says 4 soldiers were killed in a Hezbollah drone attack

articles.author: RUSS BYNUM and LAURA BARGFELD
articles.description: TAMPA, Fla. (AP) — When ankle-deep floodwaters from Hurricane Helene bubbled up through the floors of their home, Kat Robinson-Malone and her husband sent a late-night text message to their neighbors two doors down: “Hey, we're coming.”
articles.title: Determination to rebuild after Florida hurricanes, and acceptance that more will come

articles.author: GABRIELA AOUN ANGUEIRA
articles.description: BAKERSVILLE, N.C. (AP) — Nearly two weeks after Hurricane Helene downed power lines and washed out roads all over North Carolina's mountains, the constant din of a gas-powered generator is getting to be too much for Bobby Renfro.
articles.title: Volunteers bring solar power to Hurricane Helene's disaster zone

articles.author: STEPHEN GROVES
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — During his first term as president, Donald Trump tested the limits of how he could use the military to achieve policy goals. If given a second term, the Republican and his allies are preparing to go much further, reimagining the military as an all-powerful tool to deploy on U.S.
articles.title: Trump tested the limits on using the military at home. If elected again, he plans to go further

articles.author: JOSH BOAK, AAMER MADHANI and DARLENE SUPERVILLE
articles.description: GREENVILLE, N.C. (AP) — Kamala Harris used an appearance Sunday before a largely Black church audience in battleground North Carolina to call out Donald Trump for spreading misinformation about the government's hurricane response.
articles.title: From the pulpit, Harris calls out Trump for hurricane misinformation. Biden surveys Florida's damage

articles.author: JOHN HANNA and DAVID A. LIEB
articles.description: SHAWNEE, Kan. (AP) — After introducing herself at their front doors, Vanessa Vaughn West began her pitch to voters with a question: What issues are important to you? She heard frustration about rising local property taxes, a desire for smaller government and questions about affordable housing.
articles.title: Legislative majorities giving one party all the power are in play in several states

articles.author: JONATHAN MATTISE, TRAVIS LOLLER and KRISTIN M. HALL
articles.description: NASHVILLE, Tenn. (AP) — The leading private prison company in the U.S. has spent more than $4.4 million to settle dozens of complaints alleging mistreatment — including at least 22 inmate deaths — at its Tennessee prisons and jails since 2016.
articles.title: Prison operator under federal scrutiny spent millions settling Tennessee mistreatment claims

articles.author: JULIA FRANKEL
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is examining a plan to seal off humanitarian aid to northern Gaza in an attempt to starve out Hamas militants, a plan that, if implemented, could trap without food or water hundreds of thousands of Palestinians unwilling or unable to leave their homes.
articles.title: Netanyahu mulls plan to empty northern Gaza of civilians and cut off aid to those left inside

articles.author: MARCIA DUNN
articles.description: SpaceX pulled off the boldest test flight yet of its enormous Starship rocket on Sunday, catching the returning booster back at the launch pad with mechanical arms.
articles.title: In an engineering feat, mechanical SpaceX arms catch Starship rocket booster back at the launch pad

articles.author: ERIC OLSON
articles.description: Oregon and Penn State each moved up a spot in The Associated Press college football poll on Sunday following thrilling wins in high-profile games, and Top 25 newcomers Navy and Army are in the rankings together for the first time since 1960.
articles.title: AP Top 25: Oregon, Penn State move behind No. 1 Texas. Army, Navy both ranked for 1st time since '60
